TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BluetoothGattCharacteristic extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a Bluetooth GATT Characteristic

remarks.para: Represents a Bluetooth GATT Characteristic
A GATT characteristic is a basic data element used to construct a GATT service, . The characteristic contains a value as well as additional information and optional GATT descriptors, .

Offset at which the integer value can be found.
Docs.summary: Return the stored value of this characteristic.

remarks.para: Return the stored value of this characteristic.

The formatType parameter determines how the characteristic value is to be interpreted. For example, settting formatType to specifies that the first two bytes of the characteristic value at the given offset are interpreted to generate the return value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetValue() cil managed

Docs.summary: Get the stored value for this characteristic.

remarks.para: Get the stored value for this characteristic.

This function returns the stored value for this characteristic as retrieved by calling . The cached value of the characteristic is updated as a result of a read characteristic operation or if a characteristic update notification has been received.

Docs.summary: Returns the instance ID for this characteristic.

remarks.para: Returns the instance ID for this characteristic.
If a remote device offers multiple characteristics with the same UUID, the instance ID is used to distuinguish between characteristics.

Docs.summary: List of descriptors included in this characteristic.

remarks.para: List of descriptors included in this characteristic.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
